file_content.text: Wait! It was all the Republic's idea. They threatened me--I had no choice! You can't kill me!
You brought me into an ambush, you gutless worm.
That's a lie.
The Republic doesn't have the stomach for a good threat.
I don't believe you.
Don't play dumb. You set me up.
You had a choice.
You don't want me to force a confession out of you. Trust me.
Tell me the truth.
The Empire attacked my home colony. The Republic said I could get even. But it was a mistake!
Give me one good reason.
Give me that spike so I can end you.
I can, and I will.
You need me. You won't find anyone who knows more about the HK. I can help!
Your spike still needs a master identification chip. It tells the HK who his master is. I know where to find one.
It's with Koghaa the Hutt, on Quesh. His HK's all show. Holds a blaster, can't fire a shot. It's scrap, but it's got the chip you need.
I've never heard of this Hutt.
Who's Koghaa?
He was a droid smuggler. Now he's with the Three Families on Quesh. Makes droid armies for the Republic.
This is awfully convenient.
I was Koghaa's tech when he got his HK. It was badly damaged, barely intact. He fired me when I couldn't repair it.
Don't try and trick me.
There are worse places I could send you than Koghaa's. Killing's not his business.
Just don't expect him to give up without a fight. He's got mercenaries, droids and Republic backing. And he loves that HK.
Put the chip in the spike, use the spike on the HK. Any problems, I can fix them. Unless I'm dead.
The Empire won't need your services again.
I'll risk it. [Kill him]
No! I helped you, please!
Don't let me find you again. I might not feel so generous.
Get out of here. [Spare him]
Thank you. I'll get back to work right away.
Vaido. The parts for the HK spike.
Welcome back. Sorry about the mess--the Empire sent a lot of repairs my way.
I didn't expect the parts to be in such good condition. Must have gone through a lot to get these.
I didn't come back to make small talk with a slave.
Cut the chatter.
Say no more. This will only take a moment.
That better be it.
Don't worry. The end's in sight.
I enjoyed myself.
That's... wonderful. I'm so pleased for you.
One spike, ready to go. But I can't give it to you just yet. At all, actually.
The Republic sent word that you destroyed their forces at each location. I thought they could use some help.
These droids usually fight armies, and I've upgraded them. I'm not much for blood, so I'll stay over here.
You should get going. You don't want those parts to fall into the wrong hands.
I'm looking for Tren Vaido. I need an HK droid reactivated.
My lord. It's an honor. I've never talked to a Sith before. Must be important.
Can't see why a bounty hunter needs an HK. Could have killed me just now, and no one would have noticed.
You didn't have to come out here. I would have gladly come to you, at the outpost. Where there are witnesses.
I can reactivate an HK, no problem. But unless you're its master, you'll be lucky if that droid only shoots you and leaves.
It's a droid. It won't have a choice.
That can't be right.
Imagine anyone could order a droid to do something. Imagine I activated your HK and told it to shoot you. Not that I would.
Why is that?
Droids can only do what their programming says. At the end of the day, the HK's still a droid.
It won't want to.
I'm sure of that, but even a sophisticated droid like the HK won't be able to appreciate it.
A walking weapon needs safeties like any other weapon. The HK obeys its master, and blasts everything else.
We can use a spike to get around that, but it'll need some specialized parts. It wouldn't take much of your time.
What are these parts?
Define "special."
Assault hardware, targeting systems--things you want your HK to use.
How much are we talking?
I hope there's a good reason you can't get these parts yourself.
You mean "your time."
I've got a responsibility to the Empire. Plus my slave tags will explode if I go offworld.
The HK's an old model. The parts I need are in weapons they don't even make anymore, but they were used on many battlefields.
When the Empire won, they left them to rust. I can find coordinates. Just need to go scrap 'em.
Might be locals, though. Tribes, scavengers. They won't want to give up Imperial technology, so, uh, be careful.
The local rabble's no threat to me.
Not a concern.
Of course, my lord. I didn't mean to say they were.
They'll have to decide if that technology is worth crossing me.
I'll convince them.
Few things are worth crossing a Sith. None of them interest me, of course.
Bet I can hold out longer than them.
I'm not worried.
I'd take that bet.
They interfere with Imperial affairs, they die.
They'd be fools to try.
I'm sure they'll make the right decision.
Stay here.
Be back soon.
Stay put.
Looking forward to it.
No worries there. I think you'll be pleasantly surprised.
The spike will be ready for the parts when you get back. I'll be waiting.
Something I can do for you?
